techmeme.title: Sources: Google's $2.7B Character.AI deal was primarily to rehire founder Noam Shazeer, who quit Google in 2021 and made hundreds of millions from the deal (Wall Street Journal)
Sources: China-linked hackers, in a campaign called Salt Typhoon, have broken into a handful of US ISPs in recent months in pursuit of sensitive information (Wall Street Journal)
London-based Raycast, a keyboard-based macOS productivity app with third-party extensions, raised a $30M Series B and plans to release iOS and Windows apps (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
A look at Caroline Ellison's motivations in the FTX fraud, including her relationship with SBF; the judge said he had "never seen" a cooperator like Ellison (Elizabeth Lopatto/The Verge)
The Allen Institute for AI debuts Multimodal Open Language Model in 1B- to 72B-parameter sizes, the most capable open-source AI model with visual abilities yet (Will Knight/Wired)
